definitions.definition: used before nouns to refer to particular things or people that have already been talked about or are already known or that are in a situation where it is clear what is happening
examples: I just bought a new shirt and some new shoes. The shirt was pretty expensive, but the shoes weren't.
Please would you pass the salt.
I'll pick you up at the airport.

definitions.definition: used before some nouns that refer to place when you want to mention that type of place, without showing exactly which example of the place you mean
examples: We spent all day at the beach.
Let's go to the movies this evening.
I have to go to the bank and get some Euros.

definitions.definition: used before noun phrases in which the range of meaning of the noun is limited in some way
examples: I really enjoyed the book I've just finished reading.
Do you like the other kids in your class?
